FuncDef:
The password command sets the challenge password used for certificate application , which is also used to revoke a certificate.
The undo password command deletes the challenge password used for certificate application. The password command sets the challenge password used for certificate application , which is also used to revoke a certificate. The undo password command deletes the challenge password used for certificate application. By default, no challenge password is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the challenge password used for certificate application. The password is displayed in ciphertext.
The value is a string of case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain question marks (?). The password is in plaintext that contains 1 to 64 characters or in ciphertext that contains 128 to 188 characters.
To improve communication security, it is recommended that the certificate revocation password contains at least three types of lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numerals, and special characters, and contains at least eight characters.
